summary: The 'Contraband Awareness Technology Catches Harmful Fentanyl Act' (CATCH Fentanyl Act) mandates a pilot program to test and assess technologies (including AI, machine learning, and emerging technologies) to improve cargo inspections at U.S. land ports of entry. The program aims to enhance the detection of contraband, illegal drugs, and other threats. It requires the CBP Innovation Team to work with various agencies and the private sector, prioritize cost-effectiveness, and implement data privacy protections. Reports on the program's effectiveness, technology recommendations, and privacy impacts are required. No new funding is authorized.
